page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: In{local history}MANSBRIDGE is mentioned as far back as 932AD and was the only bridging point across the River Itchen until 1798-9. At present there are two bridges, a new road {bridge}(1976) and a stone one (c1800). THE GRANGE. A Tudor Manor house which was once the home of Richard Cromwell. It has since been demolished (1973). GATER'S MILL named after the Gater family who owned it between 1771-1920, was originally a corn mill known as Upmill. It later{traded}as a{paper} {mill}and Henri de Portal, who later produced banknote paper at Laverstoke, served his apprenticeship here. MONK'S PATH. Monk's Bridge, Monk's Way, Monk's Brook are all reminders of the old route taken by the monks when travelling between one of the monasteries in Winchester and the Priory of St. Denys.
